noun.description: A room, group of rooms, or building in which someone may live or stay.
examples: the cost includes airfare and hotel accommodations

noun.description: A convenient arrangement; a settlement or compromise.
examples: management was seeking an accommodation with labor

noun.description: The process of adapting or adjusting to someone or something.
examples: accommodation to a separate political entity was not possible

origin: Early 17th century: from Latin accommodatio(n-), from accommodare fit one thing to another (see accommodate).
